Browse through our applications and let us know if you have any questions. This is an electronic agreement and by selecting the booths, you are validating and approving this agreement electronically. About the event Welcome to the Jacksonville Caribbean Carnival! Come join us on Sat Aug 23, 2025, in beautiful Southside, Jacksonville, Fl., to experience the lively parade, from 12pm The parade will showcase extravagant costumes, energetic performances, and a taste of Caribbean culture like no other right here in Jacksonville! The festival gates open at 12:00 pm and will feature, flavorful Caribbean cuisine, a dance competition by the parade participants, and live performances, by local and international entertainers. Bring your family and friends to enjoy a day of celebration and fun! Don‚Äôt miss out on this exciting opportunity to immerse yourself in the rhythms of steelband, soca, salsa, compass, reggae, calypso, and the Caribbean spirit. Mark your calendars and get ready to dance the day away at the Jacksonville Caribbean Carnival! Jacksonville Caribbean Carnival Terms & Conditions Vendor spaces are BOOKING FAST!! fast. Get your PREFERRED location now! Vending Booths are NOT guaranteed until payment is made. SET-UP on Saturday, August 23rd, 2025 will be from 8:00 a.m. until 11:00 a.m. The festival gates will open at 12:00pm.. ALL Vendors MUST be in place by 11:00 a.m. and vehicles must be parked in the Vendor designated parking area to avoid unnecessary delay and/or confusion. Cars not properly parked PROHIBIT Fire/EMS approval to open the patron gates. VEHICLES WILL BE TOWED AT VENDOR EXPENSE!! VENDORS WILL NOT BE ALLOWED ENTRY AT THE VENDOR‚ÄôS GATE OR ANY GATE THEREOF AFTER 11:00 am. A Carnival representative will provide Vendor Vehicle Passes upon entering the venue. The Vending Areas must be cleared by 11:00 pm on Saturday. All vendors must clear their respective areas and provide their own industrial strength commercial grade plastic bags for garbage clean-up in and around their immediate surroundings. For Food Vendors: Proper containers must be utilized for the recovery of used oil, grease, and black water. Professional Regulators will be checking on these items. *A $200.00 fee will be charged to any vendor that is still on site after 11:00 pm. PRODUCTS LEFT FROM COOKING MUST NOT BE DISCARDED ON THE PREMISES. HEAVY FINES WILL APPLY . You shall provide your own (10‚Äôx10‚Ä≤) Tent and Generator for your coverage and power supply. Vendors must provide their chairs, tables, and decorations. After your application is accepted, there will be No REFUNDS! Vendor Guidelines(New) (pdf) Download VENDOR APPLICATION FORM Please fill in the following information: Fill Now Have Questions? Our experts are here to help you! Get ready for a vibrant day filled with music, dance, mouthwatering food, and community spirit‚Äîa true celebration of Caribbean life and heritage! Jacksonville Caribbean Carnival 2025 Feel the rhythm and embrace the color of the islands at this Caribbean-style Parade, Festival, and Concert‚Äîall in one amazing day! Saturday, August 23, 2025 8101 Beach Boulevard, Jacksonville, FL 32216 12 PM ‚Äì 9 PM From steelpan to soca, savory flavors to stunning costumes‚Äîimmerse yourself in the energy, beauty, and culture of the Caribbean, right here in Jacksonville! No passport? No problem. No trip to the Caribbean this year? No worries‚Äîthe Caribbean is coming to you! Bring your family and friends and experience the sights, sounds, and flavors of the Caribbean! Get Tickets The countdown
to Jacksonville Carnival ‚ÄúGet ready for Jacksonville Carnival ‚Äì a vibrant celebration of culture, music, and fun! Join the countdown to this annual event filled with colorful costumes and infectious energy. Don‚Äôt miss the excitement!‚Äù Days Hours Minutes Seconds Get Tickets Experience the Vibrant Spirit of Caribbean Culture at Our Carnival Carnival Weekend Tickets General Admission and V.I.P. Bring out your *flags, bandannas, and cultural colors* to represent your nation in true island style. Carnival week in Jacksonville starts with pure *PASSION* ‚Äî unity, freedom, and vibes like no other. Before you *MEGA GLO in all white on Friday* , come dressed in your *full colors* and show the world where you‚Äôre from. *, this **Thursday night* we‚Äôre turning the city into a sea of colors. Let‚Äôs set the tone as we count down to *Jacksonville Caribbean Carnival at PASSION Flag Jam!* Buy Tickets Fog It Up J'ouvert The Ultimate Paint & Powder F√™te! Kick off Jacksonville Carnival Week with pure vibes at FOG IT UP fuh J‚Äôouvert ‚Äî the wildest paint party in the city! Get ready to dance, drink, and shell down de place with your crew. EVENTENY VIPSocio EVENTBRITE Choose Your Way Of Transfer CASHAPP CARDS/CASH PAYPAL The Spirit of the Caribbean Sweeps the First Coast Welcome to Jacksonville Caribbean Carnival, bringing the Caribbean to Jacksonville, annually. Jacksonville Caribbean Carnival brings the beauty and culture of the Caribbean to Jacksonville, Fl. on Saturday, August 23rd, 2025. No trip to the Caribbean this year? No worries, the Caribbean is coming to you! Jacksonville Caribbean Carnival SANGRIA ‚Äì An All-Inclusive Experience FOG IT UP J‚Äôouvert Our Partners Upcoming Events No Post Found Hampton Inn Jacksonville South/I-95 at JTB ‚Äì is a welcoming hotel in Jacksonville‚Äôs business district: near companies, organizations, and medical and educational institutions. Stay at our Host Hotels, while you Get Away in Jacksonville. Hampton Inn, Jacksonville ‚Äì South @ JTB. Book Host Hotel Here! Please enter your actual arrival and departure dates. Enjoy convenient access to I-95, John Turner Butler Blvd, and Jacksonville International Airport, located just 20 miles from our hotel in Jacksonville, Florida. Take advantage of our close proximity to Jacksonville‚Äôs beautiful beaches, and lots of shops, restaurants and attractions, including St. John‚Äôs Town Center, Jacksonville Zoo and Park. Feel at home in a spacious guest room at this Jacksonville, FL, hotel. Stay connected with free WiFi at the well-lit ergonomic desk. Purchase snacks and drinks at the 24-hour Suite Shop, to chill in your mini-refrigerator, or heat in your microwave. Watch HD channels on the 42-inch LCD TV before getting a great night‚Äôs sleep in the clean and fresh Hampton bed¬Æ. Over sized suites are also available, with a whirlpool tub and a separate sitting area. Rooms Cut-Off Date: 08/16/2025 by midnight Make Reservations Jacksonville Caribbean Carnival Parade Mystikal Mas on the road Carnival Day Jacksonville Caribbean Carnival Park Carnival Day concert. About Us ‚Äì Jacksonville Caribbean Carnival Skip to content 4850 Collins Road, Suite #103, Jacksonville, Fl. 32244 fete@jacksonvillecarnival.com Become Event Partner Media Cart Home About Us Events Parade Vendors Volunteers Sponsorship Shop Merchandise Contact Us Home About Us Events Parade Vendors Volunteers Sponsorship Shop Merchandise Contact Us About Us THE JACKSONVILLE CARIBBEAN CARNIVAL, INVITES YOU TO JOIN OUR THREE-DAY STAYCATION IN NORTHEAST FLORIDA The Jacksonville Caribbean Carnival (JCC) is an explosion of color, culture, and community that brings the vibrant spirit of the Caribbean to Jacksonville each year! Through our Parade, Festival, and Concert, we proudly showcase the rich heritage of the Caribbean right here in our city. Attracting thousands of passionate fans from across the globe, JCC is a spectacular celebration not to be missed. Every fourth week of August, we invite you to take your vitamins and get ready for two unforgettable nights and two full days of festivity, music, and family fun‚Äîsurrounded by old and new friends alike. JCC promises an immersive experience that transports you straight to the islands, featuring live performances by local and international soca superstars such as Patrice Roberts, Skinny Fabulous, Nadia Batson, Pumpa, Adam O, and Shurwayne Winchester. Over the years, our stages have also welcomed legends like the Mighty Sparrow, Rupee, Super Blue, Farmer Nappy, Leon Coldero and Code 868, and Branches Steelband. Our Carnival concert embraces the full spectrum of Caribbean music, hosting an exceptional lineup of Reggae, Hispanic, and Haitian artists. This diverse showcase draws festival lovers from all backgrounds who share in the rhythms, traditions, and joyful energy that define the Caribbean experience. Come celebrate with us‚Äîand discover why the Jacksonville Caribbean Carnival is truly where the islands meet the First Coast! Mission Our Vision: Igniting a legacy of Caribbean exploration through diversity and inclusion with our culture. Mission Statement: Jacksonville Caribbean Carnival stands as the conduit for diversity and inclusion within the community. Our culture, inclusive of our music, food and positive outlook on life, resonates as a respected voice in Jacksonville. We own our role in cross cultural relations by educating and sharing our culture with the community while uniting cultures. We use our voice celebrate the Caribbean, increase awareness of the Caribbean, share the love of Caribbean, be of service to the community and leave a legacy of the Caribbean to enjoy. Jacksonville Caribbean Carnival promotes growth, prosperity and carnival for all. We live to love, love to jump, and jump to [whine]! MEMBERS: BOARD MEMBERS Theo Jack, Jr. Chairman Jennia White Secretary Allan Mitchell Vice President Debbie Sutton Entertainment Coordinator Carol John Community Outreach Trevon Crawford P.R.O. MEMBERSHIP CONTACT INFORMATION The Jacksonville Caribbean Carnival (JCC) Thank you for your interest in becoming a part of the JCC community! Micky brings to the role decades of leadership experience with Carnival Corporation & plc, including in-depth knowledge of the business, history and the cruise industry overall. Read Bio Josh Weinstein Chief Executive Officer Carnival Corporation & plc Mr. Weisenburger‚Äôs qualifications to serve on the Boards include his broad leadership and operational skills gained as a senior executive of a large multi-national corporation and his extensive financial and accounting skills acquired as an investment banker and senior financial operating executive. He also has broad experience in corporate governance, having served as a director, past and present, of a number of other publicly-traded companies. Read Bio Randy J. Address: Beach Boulevard Jacksonville , FL , 32216 Phone: (904) 465-1989 30¬∞ 17' 1.464" N , 81¬∞ 35' 0.924" W See map: Google Maps https://jacksonvillecarnival.com/ fete@jacksonvillecarnival.com Contact name: Theo Jack, Jr. Business/organization type: Festival/Fair committee Nonprofit organization Fundraising organization Community group Ages for which our activities are most appropriate: All Ages Adults & kids together Adults without kids The Jacksonville Caribbean Carnival, Inc. invites you to "STAY TO GET AWAY" at our exciting weekend staycation festival right here in Northeast Florida each August. We celebrate with music, dance, food, and a costume parade, like theater in the street. Then, enter the festival village to meet dozens of vendors and enjoy our International Caribbean concert to close off this exciting day of fun! Caribbean Festival is for the entire family. West Indian American Day Carnival Association About Us Mission Statement History Our Impact Board Of Directors Advisory Committee Newsletter 2025 Events Photo Gallery WIADCA Cares Programs Adult Programming Youth Programming Scholarship Program NY Carnival Week 2025 Registration Forms 2025 Rules and Regulations General Information NY Carnival Vendor Registration Visitors Information NY Panorama Junior Mas Band Adult Mas Band Events Eat Caribbean Get Involved Membership Volunteers Sponsorship Media & Press Vendor Registration Email Sign Up Contact Information Privacy Policy Terms Of Agreement Contact Information Email office@wiadcacarnival.org Phone numbers 718-467-1797 Donate Today PHONE : 718-467-1797 EMAIL : OFFICE@WIADCACARNIVAL.ORG About Us Mission Statement History Our Impact Board Of Directors Advisory Committee Newsletter 2025 Events Photo Gallery WIADCA Cares Programs Adult Programming Youth Programming Scholarship Program NY Carnival Week 2025 Registration Forms 2025 Rules and Regulations General Information NY Carnival Vendor Registration Visitors Information NY Panorama Junior Mas Band Adult Mas Band Events Eat Caribbean Get Involved Membership Volunteers Sponsorship Media & Press Email Sign Up Contact Information Donate Today West Indian American Day Carnival Association Upcoming Events & Open Registration View upcoming programs and open registration for the 2025 at the West Indian American Day Carnival Association, the largest Caribbean Carnival in North America. Spend enjoyable evenings at our multiple programs virtually. Thank you for your continued support. West Indian American Day Carnival Association Organization Profile Ms. Jessie Wardell and some of her West Indian friends started the Carnival in Harlem in the 1930√¢¬Ä¬≤s by staging costume parties in large enclosed places √¢¬Ä¬ì like the Savoy, Renaissance and Audubon 						Ballrooms due to the cold wintry weather of February. This is the usual time for the pre-Lenten celebrations held in most countries around the world. However, because of the very nature of Carnival and the 				need to parade in costume to music √¢¬Ä¬ì in door confinement did not work. The earliest known Carnival street activity was held during the 1940√¢¬Ä¬≤s when Ms. Wardell, secured the first street permit for a parade type event on the streets of Harlem. During the 1960√¢¬Ä¬≤s, another 					Trinidadian √¢¬Ä¬ì Rufus Goring, brought Carnival to Brooklyn. In 1967, Goring passed the reigns over to Carlos Lezama, who became president of WIADCA and who nurtured the organization and carnival celebrations 				till 2001, when, due to his ill-health he retired and his daughter, Yolanda Lezama-Clark served as president till 2011. Thomas Bailey was elected president in 2012. All lived in Trinidad & Tobago during 					their early lives. More About West Indian American Day Carnival Association What We Do In The Community Supporting your local community can bring a whole host of benefits to you and the people around you. Lending a helping hand can help you to make new friends, learn new skills, advance 						your career and, most importantly, give something back. Hot Meals Served 85 K Volunteer Hours 200 K More Causes WIADCA CARES WIADCA has always provided support to their community whether it would be through Breast Cancer Awareness, Holiday Season givings, scholarships and more. WIADCA Cares, has issued 							an extended rapid response to COVID-19. WIADCA CARES WIADCA EDUCATION Enable society acceptance and appreciation of the Caribbean cultural by of engaging, exposing and educating others on the aspects of the artform including culture, arts, history 							and traditions WIADCA EDUCATION West Indian American Day Carnival Association WIADCA Programs At West Inidan American Day Carnival Association we offer educational online programs for children and adults. Our classrooms are lead by a team of caring and professional teachers who 							utilize an assessment-based and cultural-driven curriculum. Our participants love staying connected to their instructors with the teaching team via our online communication tools! We use 							the YouTube to communicate messages, photos, and details about the online programs. West Indian American Day Carnival Association On Social Media @newyorkcarnival @lovenycarnival Contact Information 1561 Bedford Avenue, Brooklyn, NY 11225 Phone: 718-467-1797 Email: office@wiadcacarnival.org Donate Today As a nonprofit organization, WIADCA relies on the support of its donors, who play a large part in both the present and the future of the cultural organization. Events Tickets Products Applications Jacksonville Caribbean Carnival Starts on Saturday, August 24th, 2024 Jacksonville, Florida, United States Hosted by Jacksonville Caribbean Carnival 96 Followers Overview Tickets Get Tickets About the event Welcome to the Jacksonville Caribbean Carnival!
Come join us on Sat Aug 24, 2024, in beautiful downtown Jacksonville, Fl., to experience the lively parade, from 12pm at A. Philip Randolph Boulevard, and First Street. The parade will showcase extravagant costumes, energetic performances, and a taste of Caribbean culture like no other right here in Jacksonville!
The gates at Metropolitan Park also open at 12:00 pm and will feature, flavorful Caribbean cuisine, a dance competition by the parade participants, and live performances, by local and international entertainers. Bring your family and friends to enjoy a day of celebration and fun!
Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity to immerse yourself in the rhythms of steelband, soca, salsa, compass, reggae, calypso, and the Caribbean spirit. Mark your calendars and get ready to dance the day away at the Jacksonville Caribbean Carnival! Show more Show less Dates Aug 24, 2024 ¬∑ 12:00 PM - Aug 24, 2024 ¬∑ 9:00 PM (GMT-04:00) Eastern Time (US & Canada) The event has ended Location Florida, United States Metropolitan Park, 1410 Gator Bowl Boulevard, Jacksonville, Florida 32202, United States Directions Walk Drive Transit Bike Parking instructions Parking Lot TBD. 
All guests will pay $10 upon entry. CC only. No cash Show more Show less Health & safety TBD Show more Show less Event highlights Jacksonville Caribbean Carnival View link On Saturday, 24th August, the Jacksonville Caribbean Carnival gates at the festival venue also open at 12:00 pm and will feature, flavorful Caribbean cuisine, a dance competition by the parade participants, and live performances, by local and international entertainers.
